sen.j: 水谷 勝宗（みずのや かつむね、1623年（元和 (日本)9年）- 1689年4月8日（元禄2年2月19日 (旧暦)））は、備中松山藩の第2代藩主。
sen.e: Katsumune MIZUNOYA (1623 - April 8, 1689) was the second feudal lord of the Matsuyama domain in the Bicchu Province.

sen.j: 1684年、外様大名から譜代大名に列せられたが、このために江戸城における勤務が極端に長くなったため、しばらく藩政は子の水谷勝美と家老の鶴見良俊が担当した。
sen.e: Katsumune was appointed to Fudai daimyo (hereditary feudal lord) from Tozama daimyo (non-hereditary one) in 1684 and this made his service in the Edo Castle extremely long, therefore, Katsuyoshi MIZUNOYA, his son, and Yoshitoshi TSURUMI, the chief retainer, took charge of the domain duties for a while.

sen.j: 勝宗の藩政においては、新田開発や水路の建設、城下町の建設などに尽力している。
sen.e: In the domain duties of Katsumune, he made efforts to develop new fields, build water routes, construct a castle town, and other things.
In the domain duties of Katsumune, he made efforts to develop new rice paddies, build water routes, construct a castle town, and other things.

sen.j: また、３年にわたって松山城 (備中国)の改修を行っており、現存する重要文化財の天守は、勝宗の時代に現在の姿となったものである。
sen.e: Moreover, he renovated the Matsuyama-jo Castle (Bicchu Province) over three years and the existing castle tower, one of the important cultural properties, became what it is today in the period of Katsumune.

sen.e: Katsumune retired and transferred the family estate to Katsuyoshi, his son, in intercalary January of 1689 and died at the Sakurada Residence in February 19 of the same year.
